alert.note: Alert for Ruby Mountains and East Humboldt Range (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 10 at 2:45AM PST until January 10 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Elko
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions. Additional snow accumulations of 5 to 21 inches. Winds gusting as high as 70 mph. * WHERE...Ruby Mountains and East Humboldt Range. * WHEN...Until 10 PM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...5 to 12 inches are forecast below roughly 7000 ft and 12 to 21 inches are forecast above 7000 ft with the high-end of that range along the peaks of the Ruby Mountains and East Humboldt Range.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Ruby Mountains and East Humboldt Range
